meanings.definition: To make repeated demands on for payment.
meanings.sent1: The landlord dunned the tenant for the rent money.
meanings.sent2: The company dunned its customers for overdue bills.
meanings.sent3: The phone company dunned me so much, I started avoiding their calls.
meanings.sent4: The debt collector dunned the debtor like a relentless storm.
meanings.sent5: The image of the persistent creditor dunning for payment stuck in my mind.

meanings.sent1: The telemarketer dunned the homeowner with multiple calls.
meanings.sent2: The coach dunned the players to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The little bird dunned the cat by chirping near its ear.
meanings.sent4: The boss dunned the employees to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The image of the persistent salesman dunning customers for a sale was hard to forget.
